data.title: Winterlude calendar of events
data.meta_description: Join us at Winterlude, the Capital's winter celebration. Skate on the world's largest skating rink or play at North America's largest snow playground.
data.text:
2024-02-09 18:00 - 21:00 Sparks Street This outdoor drag show features Capital Prides's 2023 royal court with Devona Coe, Omari B Johnson and Abysskison at the performance area located between O'Connor and Metcalfe on Sparks Street! Drag performance by Devona Coe, Omari B Johnson and Abysskiss Friday, February 9, 2024 from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm Shows and street artists Sparks Street, Ottawa, ON

Join us for an outdoor drag show on Sparks Street featuring Devona Coe, Omari B Johnson and Abysskiss!

2024-02-09 11:00 - 21:00 Sparks Street The year 2024 in the Chinese calendar will make way for the wooden dragon! This representation of creative strength and courage will give you hope for a gentle and peaceful year ahead! Its charisma may seem enchanting, but you'll have to be careful not to arouse its explosive character! In this room, the wood-textured dragon reminds you that the solidity of a character can just as easily be fragile. Intertwined in the circle of the lunar calendar, he is present, imposing, but his dance teaches us that we are all part of this cosmic dance. Let's be good to ourselves and to each other! 2024, Year of the Wooden Dragon Friday, February 9, 2024 from 11:00 am to 9:00 pm Exhibitions and urban art Sparks Street, between Elgin St. and Metcalfe St.

Winterlude Ice-Carving Showcase, presented by Tim Hortons, features Marie-Line Gagné, and Isabelle Gasse as they create a monumental ice sculpture to highlight the Lunar New Year

2024-02-04 22:30 - 00:00 ByWard Market BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Ombiigizi live at The Rainbow, a free concert! OMBIIGIZI – pronounced om-BEE-ga-ZAY, meaning this is noisy – is a collaboration between Zoon (Daniel Monkman) and Status/Non Status (Adam Sturgeon), Anishnaabe artists who explore their cultural histories through sound. Their debut album, entitled Sewn Back Together is a resounding statement shaped by healing and the guidance of culture. Ombiigizi in concert at The Rainbow Sunday, February 4, 2024 from 10:30 pm to 0:00 am Shows and street artists The Rainbow - 76 Murray St, Ottawa, ON

BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Ombiigizi live at The Rainbow, a free concert!

Take in the ice sculptures of an Air Traffic Control Tower and a Search and Rescue helicopter. 100th Anniversary of the Royal Canadian Air Force Friday, February 2, 2024, all day Exhibitions and urban art National War Memorial, Ottawa ON

2024-02-16 20:15 - 00:00 ByWard Market BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Neon Ghosthouse live at The Rainbow, a free concert! Your mom’s favorite boyband, Neon Ghosthouse, is smashing their way onto Canada’s music scene. Neon Ghosthouse packs a big sound into every song, making them great for fans of Jimmy Eat World, Smashing Pumpkins and Billy Talent. The Ottawa-based emo alt-rockers have been playing together since 2021, but recording their EP has the band re-energized and tighter than ever. Neon Ghosthouse consists of Scott Martin on lead vocals, Zac MacDonald on lead guitar and backing vocals, Jack O’Sullivan on rhythm guitar and backing vocals, Logan Burke on bass and Stuart “Stu” MacFarlane on drums. Neon Ghosthouse in concert at The Rainbow Friday, February 16, 2024 from 8:15 pm to 0:00 am Shows and street artists The Rainbow - 76 Murray St, Ottawa, ON

BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Neon Ghosthouse live at The Rainbow, a free concert!

2024-02-09 18:00 - 21:00 Rideau Canal Skateway BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival hosts the 2nd IIDBF World Club Crew Ice Dragon Boat Championships on February 9 and 10. Competitors from around the globe will brave the cold on the Rideau Canal Skateway at Dows Lake. Boats adorned with dragon heads and tails are equipped with skate-like blades that glide along the frozen racecourse as competitors use spiked icepicks in pursuit of championship gold! CANCELLED - BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival Friday, February 9, 2024 from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm Winter activities, Shows and street artists Races: Dow's Lake, Rideau Canal Skateway (1001 Queen Elizabeth Drive, Ottawa, ON)

2024-02-17 10:00 - 15:00 Elsewhere in Ottawa-Gatineau Grab your board and bag of tricks, and get ready to shred! Join us for the Rideau Rail Jam, a snowboard event on the Great Lawn tobogganing hill at Lansdowne Park, 1525 Princess Patricia Way. Come and be part of the vibrant snowboarding community, do some rail sessions and show off your skills or cheer on local talent. Don’t miss this fantastic winter event! For more information, contact Top of the World. CANCELLLED - Snowboard Rail Jam Saturday, February 17, 2024 from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm Winter activities 1525 Princess Patricia Way, Ottawa ON

The course is original and made of snow, tires, tunnels and all kinds of structures! Activity leaders will entertain every race. The best recorded time becomes the record of the day to beat. At the end of the day, a prize is awarded to the person with the record title. 2024-02-03 12:00 - 15:00 ByWard Market Embark on a sweet maple sugar making journey at the ByWard Market presented by Adaawewigamig on February 3 and 4 (weather permitting). Demonstrations will take place at noon and 2 pm both days. Stop by EQ3 Plaza for an immersive experience and indulge in the sweet sounds, sights and smells of this Indigenous practice. Maple Sugar Making Saturday, February 3, 2024 from 12:00 pm to 3:00 pm Winter activities 55 byward market square

Prepare your senses for a sweet celebration of Indigenous culture with maple sugar demonstrations!

2024-02-04 11:00 - 16:00 Canadian Museum of History Come and experience a mini pow wow featuring an opening ceremony called Grand Entry and performances given by inter-tribal and guest drummers as well as by dancers of different ages and styles coming from several Indigenous communities. Organized and presented by Indigenous Experiences. It’s called mini given its short duration – a pow-wow normally lasts several days! Don’t worry, the experience will still be spectacular! Winterlude mini pow-wow Sunday, February 4, 2024 from 11:00 am to 4:00 pm Shows and street artists Canadian Museum of History - 100, Laurier Street, Gatineau, QC

Come enjoy and experience some of the customs and protocols behind Indigenous pow-wows.

2024-02-02 18:00 - 22:00 Sparks Street The Light Wave is an over 12 m long sculpture that changes as users engage with it. Lit panels are activated as participants walk, stroll or wave their arms. This lit animation is experienced up close as a shifting collage of color and reflection. From afar, the long sculpture tracks the participants with trails of light following their movements in fleeting luminosity. Since 2008, Studio F Minus has been creating accessible, innovative, landmark works of art founded on the core principle that public art not only can be, but should be, as intriguing, intelligent and complex as the people who it is made for. 2024-02-14 20:00 - 00:00 ByWard Market BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Craig Cardiff live at The Rainbow, a free concert! Over the years, Cardiff has found himself writing songs that offer pithy little bits of hope for people to hold onto. A prolific songwriter, Craig has released 21 albums and EPs independently and has found a global online audience that has streamed his songs more than 100 million times. With a voice described as “warm, scratched, sad and sleepy,” Cardiff sings songs that expose the human condition, putting a magnifying glass to our clumsier and less proud moments. He can turn any setting into an intimate affair, infusing his music and lyrics with an uncompromising humanism. 2024-02-10 20:00 - 00:00 ByWard Market BeaverTails Ottawa Ice Dragon Boat Festival presents Alanna Sterling live at The Rainbow, a free concert! Alanna Sterling is a gender-fluid vocal shapeshifter and multi-instrumentalist who is a staunch advocate for mental health. Her passion is to create music from life's struggles, inspiring others to overcome their battles. She started playing piano at age 2 and immersed herself in various art forms, including music, visual arts, dance, drama and literature. 2024-02-02 20:30 - 22:30 Downtown Rideau Asuquomo is a Canadian musician with Nigerian roots, who developed his cadenced approach to lyrics in the southeast corners of Nigeria, Port Harcourt, where Afrobeat was a major influence. He won the 2020 Ottawa Arts Council & RBC Emerging Artist Award after releasing OT Riddim mixtape, and then hitting the Top 20 EP releases in Canada by Exclaim! with his official debut EP DIOBU. Along the way, he was featured on American blogs, the likes of American Songwriter, Pitchfork, HotNewHipHop, Headlight Spirits, Pan African Magazine, etc. S.O.A.P. is a rapper/producer duo consisting of Toronto poet/rapper Scribe and Hamilton-based producer Onglish. After Onglish produced several beats on Scribe’s debut project in 2015, the two agreed to work closely to create a culture of risk and trust, pushing each other to expand their abilities. Drawing inspiration from Timbaland, Kaytranada, Mick Jenkins, Anderson.Paak and others, S.O.A.P. has a unique sound that plays inside the box in unorthodox ways. By aiming at something more emotional than flawless, Scribe & Onglish Aren’t Perfect (S.O.A.P.). Paid event Asuquomo with S.O.A.P. Friday, February 2, 2024 from 8:30 pm to 10:30 pm Shows and street artists National Arts Centre, 1 Elgin Street, Ottawa, ON
